benchmark_details.name: NOVA: A Benchmark for Anomaly Localization and Clinical Reasoning in Brain MRI
benchmark_details.overview: NOVA establishes a new benchmark for evaluating, detecting, and reasoning on unexpected abnormalities in clinical brain MRI. It includes ~900 brain MRI scans spanning 281 rare and diverse pathologies, with rich clinical narratives and expert annotations for anomaly localization, visual captioning, and diagnostic reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a rigorous testbed for advancing models capable of detecting, localizing, and reasoning about unknown anomalies in medical imaging.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is sourced from a European radiology teaching repository, which may introduce geographic or demographic biases.

data.source: Cases from Eurorad, a peer-reviewed educational platform.
data.format: PNG images and CSV metadata files
data.annotation: Annotated by at least two radiologists with bounding boxes and clinical narratives.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on standard performance evaluation techniques in object detection and text generation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in anomaly localization, image captioning, and diagnostic reasoning.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline results showed significant performance drops compared to standard image benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Evaluation conducted in a zero-shot setting, requiring models to generalize without prior exposure.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset complies with the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 license.
